title: What are the best Asian technology blogs? - Quora

response.answer_text: In short, a lot. The number of quality tech blogs has grown massively since I first arrived in 2008.  In no particular order here are some from my regular reading list: Full-time, English-language news sites: E27 (Asia)Tech In Asia (Asia)The Next Web Asia (Asia)Techcrunch Asia (Asia)ZDNet Asia (Asia)CNET Asia (Asia)Technode (China)Trak.in (India)Next Big What (India)Medianama (India)The Bridge (Japan)Digital News Asia (Southeast Asia)    Also on the radar: Serkantoto.com (Japan)China Internet Watch (China)Asiajin (Japan)beSUCCESS ENGLISH (Korea) Daily Social (Indonesia, in Indonesian)Thumbs Up (Thailand, in Thai) New update: There's been a fairly significant shift over the near-two years since this list was last updated. A lot of independent blogs have stopped producing content, and many of the personal blogs have dried up, so I've consolidated this list into those that are left -- all of which produce multiple news stories each day. Also, since most sites have multiple authors, I've dropped Quora handles for writers and editors. Disclosure: I work for TechCrunch and was formerly with The Next Web

Well, any global technology sites will do. Asia coverage is increasing due to the growing technological development of the region. Unless what you are looking for is sites in Chinese, these in English would do pretty well: Sites like TechCrunch (global) and TechCrunch AsiaZDNet (global) and ZDNET AsiaTelecom RevealedTechNode (Chinese startups)SDxCentral (Specialized in SDN, NFV)CNET (global site), and its Facebook page for AsiaDigital Trends | Technology News and Product Reviews, (global)There are other pretty good suggestions down the list.
